New Records: Alex Hales and Jos Buttler produced the greatest opening partnership in England’s Twenty20 history.
Key Match Events: England completed an all-run four, a rare event in T20 cricket.
Adil Rashid bowled excellently, going at five an over and taking the key wicket of Suryakumar Yadav.
Chris Jordan took three wickets in his first game of the tournament.
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler expressed that Hardik Pandya's innings showed what a good wicket it was.
Miscellaneous Highlights: England reached 170 with all 10 wickets and four overs to spare.
England's decision to chase was vindicated as they reached their target comfortably.
India's performance was pedestrian, with a lack of ambition with the bat.
